2093.subject: MPA
2093.descrlong: The course will introduce students to basic techniques in the art of acting, involving practical work in voice, movement, and performance skills. Initial exercises will focus on the individual student's creative process then explore its application to the work of the group. The study of acting has something for everyone in terms of rediscovering the power of one's imagination, learning how to work effectively with others, and appreciating the craft of performance.

2133.subject: MPA
2133.descrlong: The course will introduce students to basic techniques in the art of acting, involving practical work in voice, movement, and performance skills. 2134.subject: MPA
2134.descrlong: The course will introduce students to an exploration of human intention, as revealed in behavior, to be accomplished through a study of the techniques of acting, the interpretation of conflict, and the analysis of character as a form of public dialogue in Augusto Boal's Theatre of the Oppressed. Initial exercises will focus on developing the individual student's ability to use acting techniques as effective tools of social and political change.
